content: The folder hierarchy in Thunderbird directly reflects the folder hierarchy in the filesystem within the profile folder. There is no mechanism to make a folder that's not within Local Folders in the filesystem to appear as if it was in the folder pane.
creator: DavidGG

content: Actually, I haven't tried, but a symbolic link might work.
creator: DavidGG

content:
This article explains how to move the location of mail folders:

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Moving_your_mail_storage_location_-_Thunderbird

Basically, you would copy your Local Folders folder from the profile to D, then set the Local Directory to that location.

There's also an add-on to define multiple Local Folders:

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/localfolder/
creator: sfhowes

content: That's the password to the email sever thunderbird connects to. Thunderbird by itself does nothing until the user setups the email POP3/IMAP setup to retrive the emails.
creator: markwarner22

content:
Thunderbird has changed a bit since v38. You may want to check this:

https://support.mozilla.org/kb/getting-started-thunderbird-main-window-supernova

The 'Get Messages' button is that small icon to the left of the '+ New Message' button, and the option to add the column of total messages in the '···' menu to the right.
creator: DavidGG

content: Thank you. I see both now. However the icons are microscopic. The Get Messages icon blends into the background it's so small. Is there a way to make the icons larger?
creator: wdolson

content: Other places to check that you didn't mention would be Address Book using Google Contacts and the possibility that you configured some other account to use that Gmail SMTP server, which is probably still available in Outgoing Server (SMTP) settings, at the bottom of the list of accounts in the Account Settings tab.
creator: DavidGG

I want my email restored to the way it was on January 27, 2025, before the Thunderbird email update. There is important data in those Local folders and Mozilla Thunderbird should not have deleted them along with all the emails that were had colored Tags.

Please do not make me sorry that I have donated every year to keep Thunderbird running since signing up from the beginning.

content: Hamburger icon (top right)/Account Settings/Under each accounts 'Server Settings' (left) on the right untick the Server settings for new email
